pros: Friendly, flexible, decent pay, good management.
cons: Holiday and weekend requirements were tough for me to meet at the time.

pros: This hospital have some amazing aides/ techs. One of the reasons I was able to adjust.
cons: The RN’s union doesn’t want LPN’s in the hospital which cases so much commotion and confusion. After working in “training mode“ for several shifts I never returned. The RN’s have seniority and makes you feel inferior as if the N in LPN doesn’t stand for NURSE.

cons: Union for nurses Small hospital, not a large system Benefits are lacking

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Bristol, PA
pros: The employees, flexibility of scheduling, education classes
cons:
It seems as if Prime Healthcare does the bare minimum to keep their employees. We are constantly fighting for supplies and for staffing. 

High turnover rate and unsafe patient ratios. 

You must use a doctor in the prime network.

pros: A good balance between fast and slow pace, helping prevent employee burnout. Radiology is the best department in the hospital, it’s easy to get along with my coworkers.
cons: Below average pay, more comparable to a tech aide at other hospitals in the area.

pros: Pleasant atmosphere. All staff level employees were very nice to work with, although some management was very difficult to work for.
cons: Went  into bankruptcy and became a difficult place to work depending on your position.  In the end made a lot of bad choices for who was to be layed off.

job_title: Behavioral Health Tech in Bristol, PA
pros: This place is wonderful to work at. Nurses, techs, and unit clerks are hardworking, caring, compassionate people! There is a a very professional standard by which we all try to live up to, and the management is quick to notice.The CEO himself has actually addressed an issue of mine personally. I was quite impressed with his quick and decisive actions and caring enough to e-mail me his actions.I hope to work here as long as I am able
cons: Really not much of any concern. people are pretty good here.
